headline.main: MR. BLAINE ON WOOL AND SUGAR.

docs.snippet: While the "great champion of protection" and the head of Mr. HARRISON'S Cabinet is urging Congress "to open the markets of forty millions of people to the products of American farms" by providing for reciprocal free trade with the countries of South...
docs.lead_paragraph: While the "great champion of protection" and the head of Mr. HARRISON'S Cabinet is urging Congress "to open the markets of forty millions of people to the products of American farms" by providing for reciprocal free trade with the countries of South America, a prominent party organ in the West -- the orthodox Inter Ocean of Chicago -- tells the farmers that nothing but our own import duty on grain saves them from ruin.
docs.abstract: "Fooling the Farmers"; Protective Rates for Wheat and Corn; Inter Ocean Statement Compared with J. G. Blaine's Views

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 15. -- More than six months have elapsed since I last wrote THE TIMES from Brazil. These six months have been full of interest to the observer here, and regular accounts of the march of events would doubtless have been...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 15. -- More than six months have elapsed since I last wrote THE TIMES from Brazil. These six months have been full of interest to the observer here, and regular accounts of the march of events would doubtless have been appreciated by your many readers. I have been silent for a variety of reasons unnecessary to enumerate here.
docs.abstract: Brazil's Crops and Profits; TIMES'S "A. M. G." Letter on

headline.main: BRAZIL VERY PROSPEROUS; BETTER OFF IN EVERY WAY THAN UNDER THE EMPIRE. POLITICAL, FINANCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL IMPROVEMENT -- UNITED STATES INFLUENCE GROWING -- BANKING AFFAIRS -- THE MAKING OF A REPUBLICAN CONSTITUTION.

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, July 26. -- The State of Sao Paulo is the most highly-favored portion of Brazil. It has an area of about 200,000 square miles, the far greater part of which is table land with an average elevation of 2,000 feet above sea level. The coast...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, July 26. -- The State of Sao Paulo is the most highly-favored portion of Brazil. It has an area of about 200,000 square miles, the far greater part of which is table land with an average elevation of 2,000 feet above sea level. The coast line is 425 miles long, but, as the Serra do Mar generally rises abruptly from the water's edge, the extent of low-lying land is comparatively insignificant.

headline.main: BRAZIL PAST AND PRESENT; FERTILE LANDS IN THE OLD COAST STATE OF SAO PAULO. FATHER ANCHIETA'S NOBLE WORK -- FRENCH ATTEMPTS TO SEIZE RIO -- THE VALLEY OF THE PARAHYBA.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 4. -- The situation in the Argentine Republic will not improve rapidly. The Government is dealing gently with the vanquished insurrectionists, no punishments beyond dismissal from the army and navy having been inflicted. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 4. -- The situation in the Argentine Republic will not improve rapidly. The Government is dealing gently with the vanquished insurrectionists, no punishments beyond dismissal from the army and navy having been inflicted. The press, however, has been muzzled, and the two principal opposition papers, when they made their appearance last Friday, were promptly seized and their editions destroyed.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN ARGENTINE; DISASTROUS EFFECTS OF THE LATE INSURRECTION. HOW THE TROUBLE AROSE -- ROCA'S GOVERNMENTAL POLICY -- PARALYSIS OF BUSINESS AND ITS ULTIMATE EFFECT.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23. -- To-morrow, if everything goes as the members of the Tariff Conference Committee hope, the conferrees will finish their work on the Tariff bill, and on Thursday the report will be made to both houses. According to reports from...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23. -- To-morrow, if everything goes as the members of the Tariff Conference Committee hope, the conferrees will finish their work on the Tariff bill, and on Thursday the report will be made to both houses. According to reports from members of both conference committees the conferrees have agreed on everything but the sugar schedule and the duty on binding twine.

headline.main: SUGAR TRUSTS DEMANDS; TWO TARIFF BILL ITEMS NOT YET DECIDED UPON. PROBABILITY THAT THE CONFERREES WILL FINISH THEIR WORK TO-DAY AND REPORT TO-MORROW.

docs.snippet: NEW-BRUNSWICK, N.J., Oct 17. -- The Athletic Association of Rutgers College is in luck. Recently it was notified by the executors of the estate of Christopher Meyer to vacate the grounds it now uses for athletic purposes, and though it got an...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW-BRUNSWICK, N.J., Oct 17. -- The Athletic Association of Rutgers College is in luck. Recently it was notified by the executors of the estate of Christopher Meyer to vacate the grounds it now uses for athletic purposes, and though it got an extension of time, the managers were worried because they did not know where to get new grounds.

docs.snippet: Our misguided neighbor, the New-York Tribune, in an editorial article entitled "Things to Think About," tells its unfortunate readers that "free hides would mean" the closing of establishments "now in operation." One of the things our neighbor should...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our misguided neighbor, the New-York Tribune, in an editorial article entitled "Things to Think About," tells its unfortunate readers that "free hides would mean" the closing of establishments "now in operation." One of the things our neighbor should think about is the folly of making such blanders as this.
docs.abstract: Hides; Free and Reciprocally Dutiable; Tribune's Blunder
